title: Why isnt there a way to go a random skin that you own on a champion
body: why isnt there a way to make it that you go random out of the skins you own for the champion your playing?

replies.body:
In the end it's just a skin. This "button" or client setting would honestly be a waste of Riot's time/money/effort. It's not hard to cycle through and pick a different skin every game, given you actually play the champion enough. I have multiple Ahri skins and I usually stick with the same one, I like all of them but doesn't mean I'm going to alternate. Same goes for Nidalee and Akali. I have at least 3 skins for all of them but rarely use more than 1 or 2.

It's simply not that hard to switch skins yourself. What would randomizing it do if you could easily change it.
No sense of adventure! Sometimes the little surprises are what makes things more fun :(

Assign each skin a number. Go to https://www.random.org/ and change the Max Number. Use the designated skin. 

Congratulations, you now have problem solving skills
ACTUALLY I'd have you know I'm extremely adventurous!

Why? The client already decides to make you use another skin instead of the one you select anyways.

And as Famous said, it's unnecessary coding that will just bug the client more.
Because it seems stupid. I mean you can easily select a new one if you don't want to use your current skin.

But if you get mystery gifted and end up with 7 Annie skins and you like all but maybe one a random button would be nice.

You could make it a client setting rather than a button, so it just chooses a random one every time you lock in a champ and if you want to manually change it you can.
